intro: Kosteletzkya reflexiflora var. meridionalis, commonly known as the southern marsh mallow, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It features broad, heart-shaped leaves with a soft, fuzzy texture, and produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant thrives in wet or moist soils, often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological traits. Its fibrous roots and hairy stems are adaptations to its wetland habitat.
